subject: Re: ClassNotFound Exception in junit target of antscript
msgSnippet: Michael, I ve just joined this mailing list and I have exactly the same problem (I think). I m using ant 1.5.3 command line, against a class that was
messageBody:
Michael,

I've just joined this mailing list and I have exactly the same problem
(I think).

I'm using ant 1.5.3 command line, against a class that was
automatically produced by Eclipse, I didn't compile it manually.

My first test works, and now I'm writing another, but this second test
gives me the following error:

test:
[junit] Testsuite:
com.mycompany.eaitoolkit.tests.ApplicationTraceBeanTest

[junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec

[junit] Null Test: Caused an ERROR
[junit] com.mycompany.eaitoolkit.tests.ApplicationTraceBeanTest
[junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
com.mycompany.eaitoolkit.tests.A
pplicationTraceBeanTest
[junit] at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)
[junit] at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
Method)
[junit] at
java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
[junit] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
[junit] at
sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:26
5)
[junit] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)
[junit] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)


[junit] TEST
com.mycompany.eaitoolkit.tests.ApplicationTraceBeanTest FAILE
D
[junit] Testsuite: com.mycompany.eaitoolkit.tests.LoginSessionBeanTest
[junit] Tests run: 6, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 22.452 sec

So one test is working and the other not. I find it odd that it's
finding the class in the directory (I'm using <batchtest> in ant) yet
then gives a ClassNotFound error, even though it must have found the
class file to know to run the test. (Classpath?)

I'll keep digging and report back if I work anything out.

Tim.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Michael Holly" <mholly@t...> wrote:
> Craig
>
> The current compile step does compile both the test and the application
> source. The test source tree and the application source tree are
anchored
> in c:/source/mycompany/tsr/java. Both trees get compiled. I have
.class
> files for both the app and the tests.
>
> Any other ideas? It looks like my initial post got altered to a
different
> line length, making it very hared to read. Should I repost a more clear
> version?
>
> Thanks
>
> Michael
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Craig Pardey [mailto:PARDEYC@s...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 20, 2003 6:03 PM
> To: mholly@t...
> Subject: Re: [junit] ClassNotFound Exception in junit target of
antscript
>
>
>
> From what I can see in your build.xml, you're only compiling your
> production source code, not your test source code...
>
> Try replacing your compilation task with the following:
>
> <javac optimize="off"
> deprecation="off"
> debug="on"
> classpath="${classpath}"
> destdir="${deploy.home}">
> <src path="${java.source.home}"/>
> <src path="${test.source.home}"/>
> </javac>
>
> Hope this helps,
> Craig
>
> >>> mholly@t... 05/21/03 04:59am >>>
> Hi
>
> I'm trying to get up on junit and I am having a problem. I read
the FAQ,
> searched the list and I don't think I'm pulling a newbie but I may be
> wrong.
>
> My junit step is not finding the test classes that I have created. It
> just
> won't find my classes
>
> Here is my Ant build output form the junit step.
>
>
> [echo]
> [echo]
> #####################################################################
> [echo] #
> #
> [echo] # Unit Testing localhost server for the tsr application
> [echo] #
> #
> [echo]
> #####################################################################
> [echo]
> [echo] Unit testing tsr with the following environment
> [echo] classpath = c:/tomcat 4.1/webapps/tsr;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/java;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/java/test;
> c:/tomcat 4.1/webapps/tsr/WEB-INF/classes;
> c:/tomcat 4.1/webapps/tsr/javadoc;
> C:\j2sdk\jre/lib/jce.jar;
> C:\j2sdk\jre;
> c:/junit3.8.1/junit.jar;c:/junit3.8.1;
> c:/tomcat
4.1/webapps/tsr/WEB-INF/classes/test;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/servlet.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/utils.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/mail.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/log4j-1.2.7.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/activation.jar;
>
c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/commons-beanutils.jar;
>
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/commons-fileupload.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/classes12.jar;
>
c:/source/mycompany/tsr/JCE/bcprov-jdk13-116.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/xercesImpl.jar;
> c:/source/mycompany/tsr/lib/xmlParserAPIs.jar;
> [echo]
> [junit] Running test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests
> [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
> [junit] Testsuite: test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests
> [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
>
> [junit] Caused an ERROR
> [junit] test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests
> [junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests
> [junit] at
java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)
> [junit] at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
> Method)
> [junit] at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
> [junit] at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
> [junit] at
> sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:265)
> [junit] at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)
> [junit] at
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)
>
> [junit] TEST test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests FAILED
>
>
> I have a source directory that houses all the source for the
Webapp. It is
> at
> c:\source\mycompany\tsr.
>
> The actual java tree is anchored at c:\source\mycompany\tsr\java\
and has
> the following
> structure net\mycompany\tsr\...
>
> The test tree mirrors the java tree, and it anchored at
> c:\source\mycompany\tsr\java\ . It
> has the following structure test\mycompany\tsr\...
>
> The ant script compiles from the home directory to the target
directory.
> It
> is at
> c:/tomcat 4.1/webapps/tsr
>
> The test classes are being compiled and are being placed in the proper
> location in the target
> directory. I have confirmed this by verifying the .class existence.
>
> I have created some test case classes for each of the application
classes
> that are being tested.
> These test cases are rolled up into the suite in
> test.mycompany.tsr.AllTests
>
>
>
> Here are the valid sections of my ant build
>
>
> <project name="tsr" default="compile" basedir=".">
>
> <!-- This is the build for the TSR application -->
>
> <property name="server" value="localhost"/>
>
> <!-- use this property to set which compiler you want to use. -->
> <property name="build.compiler" value="jikes"/>
>
> <property name="app.name" value="tsr"/>
> <property name="company.name" value="mycompnay"/>
>
> <property name="tomcat.home" value="c:/tomcat 4.1"/>
> <property name="app.home"
> value="${tomcat.home}/webapps/${app.name}"/>
>
> <property name="source.home"
> value="c:/source/${company.name}/${app.name}"/>
> <property name="java.source.home"
> value="c:/source/${company.name}/${app.name}/java"/>
> <property name="test.source.home"
> value="c:/source/${company.name}/${app.name}/java/test"/>
>
> <property name="deploy.home"
> value="${app.home}/WEB-INF/classes"/>
>
> <property name="dist.src" value="${app.name}.jar"/>
> <property name="dist.war" value="${app.name}.war"/>
>
> <property name="javadoc.home" value="${app.home}/javadoc"/>
>
> <property name="java.home.jre.lib.ext"
> value="${env.JAVA_HOME}/jre/lib/ext"/>
> <property name="java.home" value="${env.JAVA_HOME}"/>
>
> <property name="java.jce"
> value="${java.home}/lib/jce.jar"/>
>
> <property name="junit.home"
> value="c:/junit3.8.1/junit.jar;c:/junit3.8.1"/>
>
>
> <property name="classpath" value="
> ${app.home};
> ${java.source.home};
> ${test.source.home};
> ${deploy.home};
> ${javadoc.home};
> ${java.jce};
> ${java.home};
> ${junit.home};
> ${app.home}/WEB-INF/classes/test;
> ${source.home}/lib;
> ${source.home}/lib/servlet.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/utils.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/mail.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/log4j-1.2.7.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/activation.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/commons-beanutils.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/commons-fileupload.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/classes12.jar;
> ${source.home}/JCE/bcprov-jdk13-116.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/xercesImpl.jar;
> ${source.home}/lib/xmlParserAPIs.jar"/>
>
>
> <target name="compile" depends="prepare">
> <echo> </echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
> <echo># Compiling classes at ${app.home}
> </echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo> </echo>
>
> <echo>Compiling ${app.name} with the following environment
> classpath = ${classpath};
> destdir = ${app.home}/WEB-INF/classes
> srcdir = ${java.source.home}
> </echo>
>
> <javac deprecation="off"
> optimize="off"
> classpath="${classpath};"
> destdir="${deploy.home}"
> srcdir="${java.source.home}"
> debug="on" />
>
> </target>
>
>
> <target name="unitTest" depends="clean,prepare,compile">
>
> <echo> </echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
> <echo># Unit Testing ${server} server for the ${app.name}
> application
> </echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo> </echo>
>
>
> <junit printsummary="on" dir="${deploy.home}/test" >
>
> <formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
> <test name="test.talisen.tsr.AllTests" />
>
> <classpath>
> <pathelement location="${classpath}" />
> </classpath>
>
> </junit>
>
> </target>
>
> <!-- Now lets war the site -->
> <target name="war" depends="prepare,compile">
> <echo> </echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
> <echo># Creating ${app.name} jar
> </echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo> </echo>
>
> <war includes="**/*.*"
> warfile="${app.name}.war"
> basedir="${app.home}"
> webxml="${source.home}/WEB-INF/${server}/web.xml" />
>
> </target>
>
>
> <target name="javadoc" depends="prepare,compile">
> <echo> </echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
> <echo># Creating ${app.name} documentation
> </echo>
> <echo>#
> #</echo>
>
>
>
<echo>#####################################################################<
> /echo>
> <echo> </echo>
>
> <javadoc packagenames="*"
> sourcepath="${java.source.home}"
> classpath="${classpath};"
> overview="overview.html"
> destdir="${javadoc.home}"
> version="true"
> author="true"
> use="true"/>
> </target>
>
> <!-- ########################################### -->
> <!-- This is the target that needs to be invoked.
> To do so open a command prompt and cd to
> source/mycompany/tsr/build and run ant all -->
> <!-- ########################################### -->
> <target name="all"
> depends="clean,prepare,compile,unitTest,war,configure,javadoc"/>
>
>
> </project>
>
>
> For some reason junit is not finding the test tree, because it
gives me
> the
> ClassNotFoundException. I have tried all types of combination for the
> classpath.
> I can add a test class from junit.samples and it finds it ok.
>
> Is there anything obvious that sticks out? My Compile
> step is before my junit step so I do know the classes are available.
>
>
> Sorry for the huge post...
>
> Thanks for the help
>
> Michael
>
>
>
>
